intro: Bobua morrisonicola var. matudae, commonly known as the Matudae bobua, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in inflorescences, followed by small, spherical fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Its botanical features make it an important subject for conservation and ecological studies.
